did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Correspondence, diaries, financial records, photographs, newspaper clippings, maps, and other papers, relating to mining and Staunton's personal activities in Arizona and California. Personal papers consist of diaries, notebooks, photographs and his memoirs. Mining records which include correspondence, reports, newspaper clippings, photographs, blueprints, maps, and articles by Staunton form the bulk of the collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: William Field Staunton papers (AZ 152). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Mining Engineer in Arizona and California. Staunton was mill and mine superintendent at the Tombstone Mill & Mining Co., Charleston, Ariz. from 1885 to 1894, superintendent of the Congress (Ariz.) Gold Co. 1894 to 1910. He was also general manager of the Tombstone Consolidated Mines Co. 1901 to 1910; vice-president and general manager of the Imperial Copper Co., Silverbell, Ariz., and of the Arizona Southern Railroad Co. from 1903 to 1910; and held those positions in the Southern Arizona Smelting Co., Sasco, Ariz. during 1904 to 1910.

In 1910, in Los Angeles, he established a consulting practice to develop oil and copper properties in Arizona and California. In 1911 he became vice-president, treasurer, and later president of Calumet Oil Co., Los Angeles, and president of the Verde Central Mines, Inc., Jerome, Ariz.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into three series:

list.item: Series I: Personal and Family Papers, 1852-1947
Series III: Mining Photographs, Blueprints, and Maps, 1910-1938

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, diaries, financial records, photographs, newspaper clippings, maps, and other papers, relating to mining and Staunton's personal activities in Arizona and California. Personal papers consist of diaries, notebooks, photographs and his memoirs. Mining records which include correspondence, reports, newspaper clippings, photographs, blueprints, maps, and articles by Staunton form the bulk of the collection. Correspondents include Frank M. Murphy, V.L. Mason, Henry M. Robinson, and James S. Douglas.

did.unittitle: Series I: Personal and Family Papers 1852-1947
Diaries, Diary of European Trip, Diary Index, Memoirs 1852-1947
Personal and Biographical Material (commencement programs, awards, memberships, marriage record) 1852-1947

scopecontent.p:
Includes:
"W.F. Staunton: His Scrap Book"
"Sundry Writings by W.F. Staunton"
Railroad Passes
Automobile Notebook
Radio Notebook
"Petit Dictionnaire Française"
Calumet Oil Company
Zenda Gold Mining Company
Notes on Old Income Tax Returns, 1913-1929
Notes on Smelting, Ore Contracts, Pumping Machinery, Sundry Prices, 1904
"Sundry Old Notes from 1904"
French Grammar
"Current" (various notes, personal, financial, reading lists, magazine subscriptions).
Miscellaneous Notes, 1910-1912 (mostly financial and concerning the Pan-american Ostrick Company and Calumet Oil Company).
Geological Notes
Envelope of Miscellaneous Notes, Addresses, Cards.

did.unittitle: Correspondence: Miscellaneous "R." (Note: This folder is apparently a fragment of a longer alphabetical file covering the 1920s and 1930s. It has been retained intact to indicate the probable scope of missing correspondence for this period.) 1921-1938
Tombstone Mill and Mining Company (miscellaneous papers) 1879-1901
Congress Gold Company & Congress Consolidated Mines Company (miscellaneous papers)
Series III: Mining Photographs, Blueprints, and Maps 1910-1938
Photographs: California (Balboa, Los Angeles) Puget Sound, Arizona 1910-1938
Western Land & Cattle Company-Correspondence (successor to Pan-American Ostrich Company) 1914-1925
